    • Field Detail

      • manager

        private Manager manager
        The manager object that needs to be updated with the current peers from the tracker.

      • torrentInfo

        private TorrentInfo torrentInfo
        The TorrentInfo object containing all necessary data to connect to the tracker.

      • trackerURL

        private java.net.URL trackerURL
        The URL of the tracker with given queries.

      • peerID

        private byte[] peerID
        The peerID the user will use to connect to tracker.

      • port

        private int port
        The port number the user will listen on. Conventionally, we'll start by trying to connect to port 6881, then 6882, then 6883, etc, until port 6889 where we will give up trying to connect.

      • uploaded

        private int uploaded
        The total amount uploaded so far, encoded in base ten ASCII.

      • downloaded

        private int downloaded
        Downloaded, initialized at 0.

      • left

        private int left
        Amount of the file left to download, initialized at 0.

      • event

        private byte[] event
        This is an optional key which maps to started , completed , or stopped (or empty , which is the same as not being present. If not present, this is one of the announcements done at regular intervals. An announcement using started is sent when a download first begins, and one using completed is sent when the download is complete. No completed is sent if the file was complete when started. Downloaders send an announcement using stopped when they cease downloading.

      • trackerResponse

        private byte[] trackerResponse
        Bencoded dictionary containing the keys: interval and peers.

      • trackerResponseMap

        private java.util.Map<java.nio.ByteBuffer,java.lang.Object> trackerResponseMap
        The base dictionary of the tracker response. Takes two keys: interval and peers.

      • interval

        private int interval
        Maps to the number of seconds the downloader should wait between regular re-requests.

      • pieces

        private int pieces

      • pieceLength

        private int pieceLength

      • peers

        private java.util.ArrayList<Peer> peers
        Maps to a list of dictionaries corresponding to peers, each of which contains the keys peer id , IP , and port , which map to the peer's self-selected ID, IP address or DNS name as a string, and port number, respectively.

      • KEY_INTERVAL

        public static final java.nio.ByteBuffer KEY_INTERVAL
        Key used to retrieve the interval.

      • KEY_PEERS

        public static final java.nio.ByteBuffer KEY_PEERS
        Key used to retrieve the peers.
